IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CARING, Inc. is a Christian based organization serving the frail, impaired aged and disabled, young adults.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Our mission is to communicate the love and work of Jesus Christ Our Lord for all peoples through serving the frail, impaired aged and disabled young adults. These ministries reach out to accomplish the following for as many in need as possible: Prevent institutional placement by providing community-based alternatives. Provide respite and support for families and other care givers. Present a "today-worth-the-living" to the frail and impaired elderly, and disabled young adults.
IRS990.Desc: Caring Place Medical Day Program provides specialized medically-oriented adult day care services in attractive settings for seniors and younger adults with disabilities. Two meals- breakfast and lunch- are cooked on the premises daily. The provision of medical day services enable individuals to remain independent in the community or with their families much longer than would otherwise be possible. Not only can participants avoid premature placement in long-term care facilities, but the family or other caregiver is afforded respite from full-time care responsibilities. Adult day care participants may have experienced a stroke, have dementia, have fractured a hip, or are experiencing other complications of aging.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CARING is licensed by the NJ Department of Health and Senior Services to provide Assisted Living Program (ALP) services -nursing care, homemaker services, personal care, assistance with medication, doctor appointments and transportation to residents of publicly subsidized units in their own apartments. Currently, CARING provides ALP services to eligible residents of the Atlantic City Housing Authority Jeffries Tower, Inlet Tower and John P Whittington Center, the Wildwood Housing Authority Sandman Towers, Millville Housing Authority Riverview West and Jaycee Plaza and Camden's Northgate II. CARING provides those residents with the services they require to "age in place" rather than move into a long-term care facility.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CARING's Social Day Program provides day programs to meet the needs of the elderly and disabled in a social setting providing interesting activities, trips and group involvement. The centers, located in Atlantic City, Millville and Camden, provide activities primarily for seniors who might otherwise have little or no means to get out into the community. The Atlantic City program now also coordinates its services with the Atlantic County Nutrition Site that is managed for the County by CARING.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Caregiver assistance and group home rental services

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization follows the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) guidance that requires a tax position to be recognized based on a "more likely than not" threshold. The Organization does not believe its financial statements include any uncertain tax positions. No interest or penalties pertaining to uncertain tax positions were required to be recognized in the year ended March 31, 2018.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: Some Board members of Caring, Inc. also serve on the Board of related organizations which purchase administrative services from Caring, Inc. as noted in Schedule R.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: After management has reviewed Form 990, it is distributed to the Board of Directors, and then filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Management compiles data regarding any conflicts of interest reflected on the disclosures and informs the Board of Directors of the conflict. Business practice is to avoid purchases from individuals or businesses with conflicts.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The compensation committee performs a review of the Directors' compensation and of the compensation of any other employee making in excess of $100,000 per year prior to any change for these individuals, taking into consideration the duties of the individual, his or her performance and comparable compensation of executives in the same or similar industry in the general region. In 2016, the Compensation Committee retained an independent compensation consultant to evaluate the current compensation of executives and assist with the planning of ongoing compensation. Based on that evaluation, in 2017, the Compensation Committee and CARING, Inc. Board developed a five year compensation plan for its executive group.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization generally does not make its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public. If a request were to be made, it would be considered based upon the nature of the request and a decision would be made on a case-by-case basis. Form 990 is available upon request and can also be obtained via the website www.guidestar.org.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VII, Section A, Column B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Officers of Caring, Inc. devote time to the Organization as well as other related organizations to which Caring, Inc. charges for their services under an administrative cost sharing agreement. Hours reported in this return represent the total average weekly hours for which the officer was paid by Caring, Inc.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part XII, Line 2c, Audit Oversight:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The process has not changed from the prior year.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: Housing for seniors and individuals with disabilities
